p: Psidium myrtoides oils, rich in 1,8-cineole (29.5–48.1%), α-eudesmol (11,7–20.0%), α-pinene (5.0–12.8%), elemol (3.3–6.7%), and γ-eudesmol (2.5–5.8%), with seasonal influence on its chemical compositions, showed significant fungicidal activity against Candida albicans (MFC 1.0–4.1 µg/mL, IC 50 103.3–963.8 µg/mL), and moderate against C. krusei (MFC 8.2–16.4 µg/mL, IC 50 1235.9–3564.5 µg/mL) and C. tropicalis (MFC > 16.384 µg/mL, IC 50 1671.1–2535.1 µg/mL) [ 93].
